alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 6:47AM CDT until June 02 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. For the Headwater Forecasts...including Everman, Arlington, Marys Creek, Cleburne, Cleburne, White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave, Garland, Grand Prairie Alert 10, Grand Prairie, Gainesville, Haltom City, Kaufman, Mansfield, Sachse...Moderate flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and brief, moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...From this morning to late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 89.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek. Fair Oaks Ave near the bridge will start to flood. Park and playground east of Abrams Rd will be flooded for a few hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 87.7 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 89.2 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
